intro: Physaria curvipes, commonly known as the curled-leaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the leaves are characterized by their curled, grass-like appearance. Physaria curvipes is a short-lived perennial that is well adapted to harsh, dry conditions.
